talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I've tried to make these garden beds as
perfect as they were before.

It's just so hard on my own. If only
someone would help...
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sure. Glad to help. Keep the tools a little
longer. And here's a tip...

Don't overwork the soil.
talk0068:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Hey! That raft belongs to the stable.
Don't go cutting the rope without my
permission.
talk0021: <sp:3:0:2:0800>You said you'll help! I accept your offer!
talk0069:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Hey, hold on there! You've gotta wait for
me to get aboard before you cut the rope.
talk0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Well, close enough! So what if you don't
say what you really think. I won't hold
that against you!
Now, how about you go work that soil
like you said. I'll go tend to the flowers.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>We'll have this whole garden back in
beautiful shape by the time the princess
returns. It'll be the pride of Hyrule.
Oh! And here's a tip from me...<sp:5:2:0> Put your
back into it!
talk0072:
Don't forget to cut the rope when you're
ready to launch!
talk0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm off to report back to Traysi. See you
around, partner.
talk0073:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Fella? I don't think this is the way to
<clr:0000>Floret Sandbar<clr:ffff>...
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>All this was about a sanctuary for plants
and flowers, huh?

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Sounds just like our princess to find time
to work on a garden alongside folks while
restoring Hyrule.
talk0074:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>That's our stable's raft! Please stop doing
whatever that is you're doing to it.
talk0075:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You take it from here! Just cut the rope
when you're ready to launch.
talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That was a long time ago, but I do
remember she said she needed them for
something at <clr:0000>Floret Sandbar<clr:ffff>.
It's around the river bend and then a
good distance after that.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'd take the raft there myself, but after all
<clr:0000>that stuff fell from the sky<clr:ffff>, I'm having a
hard time getting down the river.
So you might say I'm in a bind.
talk0076:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You can go. I'll stay here. What else
have I got to do, right?
talk0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>You did a great job getting us here!
Where'd you learn how to handle a raft
like that?
I thought it'd be a rough run, but it all
turned out fine.
talk0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>HEY!<sp:5:1:0>


What do you think you're doing, just
barging in here? This place is for flowers
and plants—all of them, precious!
You'd better watch out. You'll rue the
day you trample on any of them!
talk0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>S-<sp:5:0:0>sorry, ma'am!<sp:5:0:0> We're just looking for
some <clr:0000>farm tools<clr:ffff> that I lent to <clr:0000>Princess
Zelda<clr:ffff> a ways back!
I promise we won't pick any flowers.
talk0078: <sp:3:0:2:0a00>Phew... I was worried for a second there.
talk0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><sp:0:2:2:5000>*sigh* Can't talk my way out of this one...<sp:5:1:0>


And she'd, uh, probably wreck the tools if she
used 'em wrong.<sp:0:2:2:6400>

<sp:3:0:2:0701>OK, fine.<sp:5:0:0> Seems like I'm up the creek
without a paddle here. Or down it.
Either way, I'll help.
talk0079:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Fella?<sp:5:0:0> The raft's leaving without you on it!<sp:5:0:0>
You need to get it back!
talk0082:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive_01>Hm! We're a little too far.<sp:5:0:0> Would you stop
right by the dock?
talk0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL_01>I get seasick! Could you stop rocking the
raft so much?
talk0083:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><sp:5:0:0>Wait a minute... <sp:5:0:0><clr:0000>Farm tools?<clr:ffff><sp:5:0:0> Did you say
something about <clr:0000>farm tools<clr:ffff>?
talk0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Runaway_01>*hurp*<sp:5:0:0> Can you stop tilting it so much?
I get sea—<sp:5:0:0> *hurp*<sp:5:0:0> Seasick!

Urgh, it's no use... <sp:5:0:0>*hurp*<sp:5:0:0> I gotta get off
of here!
talk0084:
And also...<sp:5:1:0>nope. That's all I got.<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0400>Uh...<sp:5:1:0>what's with the face?
talk0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think>Sorry to turn you away, but I'm a little
busy right now.
talk0043:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>Just head for the <clr:0000>dock<clr:ffff> that's there. All
right, I'm counting on you!
talk0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Phew... Bad luck. Maybe try handling it
a bit more carefully?
talk0045:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey, partner. Get a good night's sleep?<sp:5:1:0>
Oh, <sp:5:0:0>actually, hold that thought.<sp:5:1:0> We don't
have time to squawk right now.
talk0046:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey, partner. How you doing?<sp:5:1:0> Actually,<sp:5:0:0>
let's just get to it.<sp:5:0:0> You're always on an
even keel.
talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I got a very interesting lead about our
missing princess. We could have a pretty
huge story here.
Sounds as if one night a while back—and
I'm not sure how far—<clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>
borrowed this stable's farm tools.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>That's a bit unusual. Why would our
princess...<sp:5:0:0>need farm tools?<sp:5:1:0> But this story
has another odd twist.
She promised to return them...<sp:5:0:0>and didn't.<sp:5:1:0>
Now, this all might seem trivial. She's a
busy princess, after all.
Still, these are strange times. So I got to
thinking—only <clr:0000>weapons decayed <clr:ffff>during
the Upheaval.
Maybe the princess was in desperate
need of tools for...<sp:5:1:0> Wait, Penn...<sp:5:0:0> Hold on.
You've gotten ahead of yourself.
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>We need to gather the facts—when, what,
where, who!

Let's start at the beginning. I heard that
a man named <clr:0000>Izra<clr:ffff> lent her the tools.

He's right around here—watches over
the stable's raft, I heard. Let's get to
work, partner.
talk0047:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What's wrong? Did you forget where
<clr:0000>Floret Sandbar <clr:ffff>is?
talk0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>What did <clr:0000>Princess Zelda <clr:ffff>need those
<clr:0000>farm tools <clr:ffff>for?

I have a wild guess that it's because only
<clr:0000>weapons decayed <clr:ffff>during the Upheaval,
and that would mean...
<sp:3:0:2:0700>No, we need facts! I heard that a man
named <clr:0000>Izra<clr:ffff> spoke to the princess. I think
he watches over the raft at this stable.
talk0050:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey, partner. You have a good day?<sp:5:1:0>
Oh, <sp:5:0:0>actually, hold that thought.<sp:5:1:0> We can
squawk all about it later.
talk0002: <sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think>Sorry, I'm a little busy right now...
talk0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This rain, huh, partner? Will it ever end?
Oh, <sp:5:0:0>no need to answer that.<sp:5:1:0> I know it'll
end at some point. Just making small talk.
talk0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Urgh.<sp:5:1:0> How can I get any work done right
unless I get the stable's tools back?
talk0052:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I'm ready whenever you—


<sp:3:0:2:0300>Um, hold on. <sp:5:0:0>I can't sit down in the chair.
talk0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>*sigh*<sp:5:1:0> I know we could clear up this mess
if someone could take me downriver to
<clr:0000>Floret Sandbar<clr:ffff> on the raft.
talk0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:SurpriseS>Huh? Up in the sky! There's something...<sp:5:0:0>
er, someone...<sp:5:0:0>coming at us!
talk0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>Oh... I was wondering when you guys
would show up. You work with Penn from
the newspaper, right?
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I didn't want this to get out, because I
don't want people to think I'm saying bad
things about <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>.
But she borrowed our stable's <clr:0000>farm tools<clr:ffff>
and hasn't given them back.
talk0055:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease>Whew... Finally caught up with you two!


I was flying around this whole area,
partner, trying to find our facts, when I
saw you on this raft.
I figured you'd chased down our story,
so I flew right on down to help. But, uh...<sp:5:0:0>
where are we?
talk0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What?!<sp:5:0:0> You mean that, fella? You'll take
me to <clr:0000>Floret Sandbar<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thanks!<sp:5:0:0> Can't tell you how much I
appreciate you offering to do that.
talk0056:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Whoa! Who's this?<sp:5:0:0> Ever met her
before, partner?
talk0057:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, really?<sp:5:0:0> Let's get off the raft and
start from scratch, then.
talk0058:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Well, seems like we got those facts we
wanted,<sp:5:0:0> and those two...<sp:5:0:0>worked it all
out, I guess?
I can't wait to write this up. Our readers
love glimpses into the princess's life. Here
she was, helping to create a garden.
Expect the story in an issue of the paper
soon. It'll be a real headline!
talk0059:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What the—<sp:5:0:0> Where's my raft?<sp:5:0:0> I better put
it back where it was to start.
talk0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>*sigh* <sp:5:1:0>I wonder why Princess Zelda won't
give the stable's tools back.

I want to go downriver to <clr:0000>Floret Sandbar<clr:ffff>
and find out what happened, but I'm
having a hard time with the raft.
talk0061:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>So, you're going to take me to <clr:0000>Floret
Sandbar<clr:ffff> on this raft?
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Picking them? I'm more worried about
you kicking them!<sp:5:1:0>
talk0063:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey! Where are you taking me? This is
NOT the way to <clr:0000>Floret Sandbar<clr:ffff>!

Look, it seems like we're lost. How about
we go back to the dock and start over?
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>That's right—some <clr:0000>farm tools <clr:ffff>from our
stable. I want them back!
talk0064:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Tell me when you're ready to go. Don't
forget, OK? You're my last hope!
talk0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, well. That's my fault. I have them.


This area is home to <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>'s
plant sanctuary. She asked me to take
care of this special place with her.
She loved these plants, and spent a lot of
time here, making sure the garden beds
were happy homes for them.
We meant to return the tools after we
finished our work here.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>But the princess—well,<sp:5:0:0> they say she
went <clr:0000>missing<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>And all our hard work was ruined when...<sp:5:0:0>
oh, these darn ruins crashed down!
It's been really awful.
I've been working so hard since then to
try to make it all nice again.
talk0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Really? <sp:5:0:0>That's what happened?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Now I think about it, I didn't tell the
princess how soon I needed our stable's
tools back.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>As long as they're in good condition,
it's no problem. I'll just go ahead and take
them with me if you're done.
Now I feel guilty for some reason. Didn't
mean to make you hurry it up.
